summary: WIP - Makes Skyrim clothes less covering. REPLACER.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ebaf2d][b][size=5][u]Summary[/u][/size]
Description
About the two versions
Requirements
Installation
Clothing done
FAQ[/b][/color]
[color=#fead28]-[size=1]Is this compatible with retexture mods?[/size]
-[/color][size=1][color=#ebaf2d]Can I use both[/color] [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color][color=#ebaf2d] and[/color] [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color][color=#ebaf2d] at the same time?[/color][/size]
[color=#fead28]-[size=1]I can see parts of the body going through the clothes, why is that?[/size]
-[size=1]There is a lot of space between the armor and the body, could you reduce it?[/size]
-[size=1]Can you do this particular armor/clothing?[/size]
-[size=1]I didn\'t manage to install this, could you be more precise in your instructions?[/size][/color]
[color=#ebaf2d][b]Known issues[/b][/color]

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]Description[/b][/u][/size][/color]

As Skyrim has a very hot weather (mainly due to those white volcano ashes in the air and on the ground), I decided to make the clothes more [s]revealing[/s] comfortable.

This is a work in progress mod, but I plan on doing as much clothes and armor as I can with the limits of the actual tools, while preserving a vanilla-like look (that\'s subjective, I know). I will make male and female clothes, as it would be strange to take a clothing off a male and put it on a female and see that most of it has just vanished. Or not, cause I\'m lazy. We\'ll see...

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]About the two versions[/b][/u][/size][/color]

If you are wondering what\'s different between version [color=#00FF00]0.#.#[/color] and [color=#00FF00]1.#.#[/color] here is the answer.
Mainly [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] is texturing work while [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] is modelling work. This means that, in order to remove pieces of clothing, in [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color], I made the unwanted pieces invisible, [b]but they are still here[/b], and in [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] I actually removed parts of the clothes and made the rest fit the body.
As for the body, [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] uses the only body that was available at the time, the vanilla body, and [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color], done after our modding possibilities had widen, uses a more elaborate body, the one I prefer, UNP.

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]Requirements[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] You\'ll need to install the textures of a female nude mod (like [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=33505]Thepal[/url]\'s [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=70]mod[/url], which is the one used in the screenshots) if you don\'t want a barbie doll texture.
[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/6709]DIMONIZED UNP Female Body[/url].

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]Installation[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[color=#ebaf2d][size=4][b]Easy Installation[/b][/size][/color]
Download and install with the [url=http://www.skyrimnexus.com/content/modmanager]Nexus Mod Manager[/url] (you need the file with the NMM installer included) : Easy installation (see screens), update, and uninstallation (not that you would want this last one of course).
If you prefer [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/1840]Wrye Bash[/url], a BCF is provided. You know what to do with it. (btw, if the bcf could be improved, tell me, I never used BAIN before, I may have missed something).

[b][NOT RECOMMENDED][/b] [color=#ebaf2d][size=4][b]Manual Installation[/b][/size][/color] 
[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] Simply extract the Data folder in the Skyrim folder (typically C:/Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/skyrim)
If you want the \"less\" version, you\'ll need to install the main version and then overwrite it with the \"less\" textures.
[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] Extract the desired content in you Skyrim folder (see detailed info in files).

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]Clothing done[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color][color=#ebaf2d][size=4][b]For Thepal\'s nude mod :[/b][/size][/color]

(D) = available in default version
(L) = available in \"less\" version

[b]? Archmage\'s robes[/b] (D) [color=#676767][10f570][/color]
[b]? Journeyman model[/b]:
 ??? \"College robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][d3dea][/color]
 ??? \"Expert robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][10d662][/color]
 ??? \"Master robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][10d664][/color]
[b]? Mageapprentice model[/b]:
 ??? \"Adept robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][10cee3][/color]
 ??? \"Apprentice robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][10d67d][/color]
 ??? \"Novice robes\" (D+L) [color=#676767][10d2b4][/color]
[b]? Mythic dawn robes[/b] (D) [color=#676767][b144d][/color]
[b]? Nightingale armor[/b] (D) [color=#676767][483c2][/color]
[b]? Prisoner model[/b]:
 ??? \"Ragged trousers\" (D) [color=#676767][8f19a][/color]
 ??? \"Roughspun tunic\" (D) [color=#676767][3c9fe][/color]
[b]? Thalmor robes[/b] (D+L) [color=#676767][65bbf][/color]
[b]? Merchant model[/b]:
 ??? \"Clothes\" (D) [color=#676767][4223c][/color]
 ??? \"Clothes\" (D) [color=#676767][6ff45][/color]

[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color][color=#ebaf2d][size=4][b]For UNP BASE :[/b][/size][/color]

[b]? Mageapprentice model[/b]: (4 versions, see screens)
 ??? \"Adept robes\" [color=#676767][10cee3][/color]
 ??? \"Apprentice robes\" [color=#676767][10d67d][/color]
 ??? \"Novice robes\" [color=#676767][10d2b4][/color]
[b]? Merchant dress[/b]:
 ??? \"Clothes\" [color=#676767][4223c][/color]
 ??? \"Clothes\" [color=#676767][6ff45][/color]
[b]?Merchant boots[/b]:
 ??? \"Boots\" [color=#676767][4223d][/color]
[b]? Nightingale armor[/b] [color=#676767][483c2][/color]
[b]? Nightingale boots[/b] [color=#676767][483c1][/color]
[b]? Nightingale gloves[/b] (2 versions) [color=#676767][487d1][/color]

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]FAQ[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[list][b][*][color=#fead28]Will you do a CBBE version?[/color][/b]
NO. Modifying skyrim\'s armor and clothes is a pain in the ass (mainly due to this lame weight system), so I will ONLY do this for my favorite body, UNP. And that\'s non negociable.
But don\'t worry, there\'s a very similar mod for CBBE, made by TigerfishBites, [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/4803]here you go[/url].

[b][*][color=#fead28]Is this compatible with retexture mods?[/color][/b]
[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] Yes.
[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] Not unless the author of the retexture provided a compatible version, but it is easy to do so if you know how to edit the textures.
- [color=#fead28]Yes I know![/color]
Then, install my .nif and your texture mod .dds and copy the alpha channel from my .dds to the one of the retexture you want.
- [color=#fead28]No I don\'t.[/color]
Try asking the author of your retexture to make a compatible version or look at a .dds editing tutorial, plenty out there.

[b][*][color=#fead28]Can I use both[/color] [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color][color=#fead28] and[/color] [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color][color=#fead28] at the same time?[/color][/b]
Yes. If you want to use [color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] and the clothes only available in [color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color], just install a nude mod for vanilla body (e.g. Thepal\'s), THEN install UNP and overwrite when prompted.

[b][*][color=#fead28]I can see parts of the body going through the clothes, why is that?[/color][/b]
[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] That\'s not normal, report it.
[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] [s]That\'s because I can\'t edit the mesh right now.[/s] I use vanilla body and vanilla meshes, but they don\'t always perfectly match, so there is clipping issues. I reduced the clipping on some clothes where it was really important, by making the clothing bigger, but it\'s not really a solution.
[s]When blender has a full support of Skyrim meshes, I will make the clothes better fit the body. For now, I do what I can with what we have.[/s] -> This is done in v1.#.#.

[b][*][color=#fead28]There is a lot of space between the armor and the body, could you reduce it?[/color][/b]
[color=#00FF00][v1.#.#][/color] If you think it could be better, report it.
[color=#00FF00][v0.#.#][/color] For the same reason than the previous question, my hands are tied. The only thing I can do is make the clothing smaller, but this adds more clipping, so I can\'t really do it. When blender has a full support of Skyrim meshes, I will make the clothes better fit the body. For now, I do what I can with what we have. 

[b][*][color=#fead28]Can you do this particular armor/clothing?[/color][/b]
I can\'t promise you anything more than looking into it at some point. Some clothes give me ideas, like the apprentice robe, which I imagined like it is in my mod as soon as I encountered it in game, and some clothes just don\'t inspire me and will most likely not be modded or at the end when I have modded those for which I have ideas.

[b][*][color=#fead28]I didn\'t manage to install this, could you be more precise in your instructions?[/color][/b]
I don\'t see what more to say. If you can\'t install that, I highly recommend you to install the Nexus Mod Manager to have a easy one-click install/uninstall.[/list]

[color=#ebaf2d][size=5][u][b]Known issues[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[color=#00FF00][Solved in v0.1.2][/color] There are problems with heavy characters, they wear vanilla robes.
author: Gilead Maerlyn
